attributes.action: Investigate dis/misinformation use during BREXIT, before the UK leaves the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
- 250+ senior academics criticize deliberate campaign misinformation in EU Referendum  (an open letter in the Telegraph 14 June 2016)
-UKIP's appeal has been dismissed and ICO tries to continue its investigation into use of data analytics. (2018)
-The Electoral Commission concluded Vote Leave broke electoral law. (2018)
-UK Statistics Authority "The continued use of a gross figure in contexts that imply it is a net figure is misleading and undermines trust in official statistics." (2016)
attributes.background:
Democracy requires an informed public and representatives. 
-"Disinformation and 'fake news': Final Report" (www.Parliament.uk 2019) 
"We further recommend that the Government launches an independent investigation into past elections—including the UK election of 2017, the UK Referendum of 2016..."
